We must move these tax treaties forward to boost our economy and protect American businesses.
Tax treaties strengthen the ability of U.S. businesses to explore new opportunities abroad and help prevent fraud.
By preventing double taxation, tax treaties facilitate trade and foreign investment, which boost our economy here at home.
Tax treaties protect Americans and businesses from double taxation – crucial for American individuals and businesses abroad.

Learn everything u can, respect others, have ethics, love the people that got you here, have a deep, abiding faith & dream #SixSilentSecrets
Secret #6: Dream - There are as many successes in life as there are graduates here today, if you are willing to dream. #SixSilentSecrets
Secret #5: Faith - Faith is a series of disappointments held together by singular moments of joy and success. #SixSilentSecrets
Secret #4: Love – ‘Always remember to love people, and use things – don’t ever use people, and love things.’ -Will Rogers #SixSilentSecrets
Secret #3: Ethics - Doing right is sometimes the most difficult thing to do, but it is always the best thing one can do. #SixSilentSecrets
Secret #2: Respect - We’re all different sizes/shapes/ethnicities/creeds, but every1 has something 2 offer our fellow man. #SixSilentSecrets
Secret #1: Learning - treat your diploma like a passport & have it validated over & over by learning & improving yourself. #SixSilentSecrets
What is your secret to living a happy, successful & fulfilling life? Reply using hashtag #SixSilentSecrets to share!

ICYMI: Here's a clip from @FoxNews @SpecialReport about the Senate field hearing that Johnny held in ATL to address VA mental health care.
Glad to meet with the Paulding Chamber this morning!
@tabwoodward Yes, executed. Apologies for the typo.
JI: We have all learned a lot. I know I've learned a lot. Hopefully these ideas will be excused to improve the care of our vets.
JI to VA on utilizing Atlanta's many medical resources: Help is not on the way, it's right next door...but you have to invite them in.
Vet Vondell Brown to JI and VA: "We don't care how much you know until we know how much you care." (Roaring applause from vets in audience.)
JI: I hope a byproduct of this hearing will be a better idea sharing mechanism within the VA.
Testifying now: Rebecca Hayes, Dir. of Nursing and Clinical Services at Peachford Hospital.
Testifying now: Dr. Ryan Breahears, Dir.  of Psychology at WellStar Health System.
Susan Johnson, Shepherd Center, asks VA for better collaborative partnership.
Testifying now: Susan Johnson, Dir. of Brain Injury Services @ Shepherd Center. Discusses issues w/ appointments, backlog & coordination.
Hearing uncovers that VA is not always willing to embrace outside help from private-sector expert organizations in the mental health field.
JI to V. Brown: "Your testimony is not only a service to the cmte but also advice for the VA to respond to." (Brown received long applause)
Vondell Brown: "There's much more to be done to close the gaps in the VA mental health system."
Vondell Brown: "Providing care requires trust between the provider and the patient." Says this is not always the case at the ATL VA.
Vondell Brown, veteran with the Wounded Warrior Project: "The VA can't do it alone... Community partners make a real difference."
Gen. Butterworth, GA National Guard, testifies: over the last decade, there have been 18 suicides within GA Nat'l Guard alone.
JI asks the VA to stay for panel 2, which will focus on best practices from the private sector in mental health care.
JI to VA: Don't make promises here that you can't keep. We're going to keep you accountable.
JI points out that VA health care is not subject to sequester or a govt shutdown & is fwd funded. "Quality of service should meet funding."
JI to Dr. Petzel: It's embarrassing that it took 2 whistleblowers through a hotline to uncover these issues. You should have looked into it
JI: I don't think the VA hospitals talk to each other... There needs to be better communication between the VA facilities.
Senator Isakson is now addressing the common issue of overmedication. Asks Atlanta VA Medical Center Director Wiggins to comment.
JI: It is inexcusable that 21% of veterans who were recommended to contractors never received these services.
JI: We have to do a better job... This is not just a VA problem, it's an American problem.
JI: Suicide among veterans is a rampant problem and its getting bigger and bigger.
